Package eea.engine.event

This package provides the generic event classes in the eea framework.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
ANDEvent Multiple events can be combined using a logical conjunction (AND).
Event An event describes something that "happened", for example, a collision between two objects, mouse or keyboard actions.
OREvent Multiple events can be combined using a logical disjunction (OR).
 

Package eea.engine.event Description

This package provides the generic event classes in the eea framework. Each event can be decorated with an arbitrary number of associated actions. The Event.performAction(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer, org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame, int) method is used to determine if the associated actions shall actually be executed; for example, a CollisionEvent will only cause its actions to be executed if the entity owning the event has collided with an other entity. The Event.update(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer, org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame, int) is used to tell each associated action for the event to update itself when update is called and Event.performAction(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer, org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame, int) has returned true. The two subtypes ANDEvent and OREvent have slightly different semantics in that they will only perform an action if all (ANDEvent) actions indicate their willingness to perform the action, or if at least one (OREvent) action does so.
